block.p: Meghan Whitney Hall, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Turnbull Hall 3d of Princeton, N.J., was married last evening to Ryan Edward Donaldson, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Patrick F. Donaldson of Glencoe, Md. The Rev. Christopher R. Sherrill, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Trinity Church in Princeton.

The couple graduated from Washington and Lee University and work in New York. Mrs. Donaldson, 26, is an account executive at Grey Advertising; Mr. Donaldson, 25, is an equities analyst at Goldman, Sachs & Company, the investment bank.

Meghan Whitney Hall, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Turnbull Hall 3d of Princeton, N.J., was married last evening to Ryan Edward Donaldson, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Patrick F. Donaldson of Glencoe, Md. The Rev. Christopher R. Sherrill, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Trinity Church in Princeton.

The couple graduated from Washington and Lee University and work in New York. Mrs. Donaldson, 26, is an account executive at Grey Advertising; Mr. Donaldson, 25, is an equities analyst at Goldman, Sachs & Company, the investment bank.
The bride's father is a partner in the law firm of Reid & Priest, working in the firm's Washington and New York offices.

The bridegroom's mother is the chairwoman of the English department at the Old Fields School, a private girls' school in Glencoe. His father is a partner in Construction Industrial Programs, a company in Beltsville, Md., that markets industrial equipment.
